content:
I'm happy to help you with your living room redecoration! However, I'm a large language model, I don't have access to your location, so I can't recommend local interior designers in your area. But I can suggest a few options to find a great interior designer:

1. Online Directories: Websites like Houzz, Interior Designers Association (ASID), and National Kitchen and Bath Association (NKBA) have directories that allow you to filter by location and find certified interior designers in your area.
2. Social Media: Check out social media platforms like Instagram, Facebook, and Pinterest, where many interior designers showcase their work and share their portfolios. You can search for hashtags related to interior design and your location to discover local designers.
3. Word of Mouth: Ask friends, family, or neighbors who have recently redecorated their homes for recommendations. They can provide valuable insights and referrals to local designers they've worked with.
4. Local Design Schools: Reach out to local design schools or colleges with interior design programs. They may have a list of recent graduates or professors who offer design services.

Regarding your bike, that's great that you've freed up space in your garage! A tune-up is a great idea to get your bike road-ready again. You might consider taking it to a local bike shop or searching online for DIY tutorials if you're comfortable with doing the maintenance yourself.

Remember to provide me with more details about your living room, such as your style preferences, budget, and any specific design elements you're interested in incorporating, and I can offer more general advice and guidance to help you get started on your redecoration project!
